ARABIC: فَلْيَضْحَكُوا۟ قَلِيلًا وَلْيَبْكُوا۟ كَثِيرًا جَزَآءًۢ بِمَا كَانُوا۟ يَكْسِبُونَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Let them laugh little and weep much, in repayment for what they have earned.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: So let them laugh a little, for weep they will, more as retribution for what they have done.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Let them, then, laugh little, and weep much at the contemplation of the punishment for the evil they have committed.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: They should laugh less and weep more as a recompense for what they have gained.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: So they should laugh a little and weep much; the reward of what they used to earn.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: So let them laugh a little and (they will) cry much as a recompense of what they used to earn (by committing sins).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Therefore they shall laugh little and weep much as a recompense for what they earned.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Therefore let them laugh little, and weep much, in recompense for what they have been earning.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Then let them laugh a little: they will weep much, as the reward of what they used to earn.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Let them laugh a little and weep much in return for their misdeeds.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Little then let them laugh, and much they shall weep: the meed of that which they have been earning.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: So let them laugh a little; much will they weep as a requital for what they used to earn.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Let them laugh a little: much will they weep: a recompense for the (evil) that they do.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: So let them laugh a little and (they will) cry much as a recompense of what they used to earn (by committing sins).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: They shall laugh but little and shed many tears. So shall they be recompensed for their earnings.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Let them laugh a little, and weep much; in recompense for what they used to earn.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: So let them laugh a little and [then] weep much as recompense for what they used to earn.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [9:82] But let them laugh a little, in this world, and weep much, in the Hereafter, as a requital for what they used to earn (the sentence is predicative of their state, expressed in the form of an imperative).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Then let them laugh a little) in the life of this world: (they will weep much) in the Hereafter, (as the award 204 of what they used to earn) of what they used to say and do of transgression.
